AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: There is some evidence that the ATLAS AI-generated intake added potentially irrelevant/boilerplate content (e.g., white-label shutdown notice) and did not materially help resolve the core issue beyond opening a ticket. However, most of the troubleshooting and resolution occurred via human agents, so the AI quality impact is indirect/uncertain.
evidence: Kayako - ticket id 60214613 // ATLAS commented privately: "--- Ticket generated by StreetSmart AI chat ---"
ATLAS chat transcript: "❗ IMPORTANT NOTICE ❗ ... White-labeled versions of StreetSmart will no longer function after this date."
ATLAS chat transcript: "For now, I am unable to take any file uploads..."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer was not stuck in an AI loop and did not request a human; the ticket quickly transitioned to human support replies and ongoing collaboration with internal teams.
evidence: Kayako - ticket id 60214613 // Shaquille De Lancy commented publicly: "Dear Andrew, Thank you for contacting the StreetSmart Support Team..."
Kayako - ticket id 60214613 // Raymond Guirguis commented publicly: "Dear Andrew, The ATLAS automation for this customer is currently not functioning..."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support initially acted on an incorrect Salesforce opportunity link and assumptions (renewal vs first-time activation), requiring the requester to correct key context. Later troubleshooting also leaned on generic cache/cookies steps even though the ultimate root cause was email case-sensitivity in automation (suggesting the investigation path did not fully incorporate the context of an automation/mapping issue).
evidence: Shaquille (public): "...due to StreetSmart-specific fields on the customer's Salesforce instance [https://trilogy-sales.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/0062x000008o1lQAAQ/view] not being set."
Customer: "This is the correct Salesforce opportunity: https://trilogy-sales.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/006Ih000004fwJXIAY/view"
Alexandr (public): "Could you please ask the user to clear cache and cookies, restart the browser and relogin..."
Raymond (private): "it is a case sensitivity issue with the automation. will fix it in few minutes."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The overall ticket lifecycle was long (created Oct 6, solved Oct 18, closed Oct 21) despite the core fix being communicated on Oct 11, indicating extended time-to-resolution/closure. There were also multiple 'hold' periods while waiting for internal onboarding work.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket was ultimately marked solved/closed without explicit customer confirmation of successful resolution after the final fix (the last customer message was that the issue persisted). While it’s possible the customer later confirmed elsewhere or simply didn’t reply, the closure timing suggests potential auto/administrative closure risk before verification.
evidence: Customer (after prior 'onboarded' message): "The customer reports still seeing the following error... Kindly assist."
Raymond (public): "This has now been resolved. Could you please ask the customer to try again?"

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The issue was flagged as 'Urgent' and involved inability to add devices due to no active licenses (a potentially business-blocking condition), yet it required multiple days and internal onboarding steps to restore functionality. While support did engage and escalate internally, the handling included holds and extended resolution time that could be seen as inconsistent with urgent severity (severity level remains somewhat uncertain).
